item.title: DCCP: The socket type you probably never heard of
item.description: TL;DR: DCCP is a relatively newer transport layer protocol which draws from both TCP and UDP. Jump straight to the example C code. Background Historically, the majority of the traffic on the Internet has been over TCP which provides a reliable connection-oriented stream between two hosts. UDP has been mainly used by applications whose brief transfers would be unacceptably slowed by TCP’s connection establishment overhead or those for which timeliness is more important than reliability.
